paragraph.paragraph:
In both trees of the
00_introduction.xml object tool , objects are displayed. Two categories are made for each objects: its attributes (grouped under the `attributes' folder
/images/eiffelstudio/icons/16x16/feature_attribute_icon.png ) and its once routines (grouped under the `once routines' folder
/images/eiffelstudio/icons/16x16/feature_once_icon.png ).
All follow the following symbol scheme to describe the kind of each item:

list.item:
/images/eiffelstudio/icons/16x16/debugger_object_immediate_icon.png An attribute of a basic type, such as
INTEGER /libraries/base/reference/kernel/integer_chart.xml ,
DOUBLE /libraries/base/reference/kernel/classic/double_chart.xml ,...
/images/eiffelstudio/icons/16x16/debugger_object_eiffel_icon.png An attribute that is a reference to an object

paragraph.paragraph: For .NET system, special symbols are used to describe :

list.item: /images/eiffelstudio/icons/16x16/debugger_object_dotnet_icon.png An object that is external (i.e not known as an Eiffel type)
/images/eiffelstudio/icons/16x16/debugger_object_dotnet_static_icon.png A static value object that is external (i.e not known as an Eiffel type)
/images/eiffelstudio/icons/16x16/debugger_object_static_icon.png A static value object that is known as an Eiffel type
